intro: Oxytropis bicolor var. luteola, commonly known as yellow globemallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, and it has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and potential medicinal use.
